newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish brokerage sees NBP rate cut in Sept or Oct.
newsitem.headline: Polish brokerage sees NBP rate cut in Sept or Oct.

text.p: The National Bank of Poland (NBP), the central bank, is likely to cut its main interest rates for the third time this year in September or October, the Bank Handlowy brokerage said in a report released on Monday.
"One can expect at least one more cut in interest rates... in late September or early October," the report, dated July 26, said.
On July 16, the central bank cut its lombard and discount rates by one point to 25 percent and 22 percent, respectively.
In January, the bank cut rates by two points to 26 percent and 23 percent, respectively.
